attributes.action: Allow travellers from Southern Africa to self-isolate on return to the UK
attributes.additional_details:
We appreciate the uncertainty the new Omnicron variant brings. We're asking the Government to afford responsible citizens, who are 
fully vaccinated, the opportunity to travel home to Southern Africa & self-isolate on their return.

The current hotel quarantine is not an affordable option for many & this is robbing many people the opportunity to see family for the first time in 2 years due to the COVID pandemic & unaffordable hotel quarantine.

PCR testing before and after arrival should be used
attributes.background:
We're petitioning Government to allow fully vaccinated travellers from the Southern African region to self-isolate at home on their return to the UK and complete compulsory PCR test on day 2 and 8.

The current hotel quarantine is unaffordable and robbing people the chance to see family.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588072
